# quantrecipes

## Installation

You can install the development version of `quantrecipes` using:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("bagasbgy/quantrecipes")
```

## Getting Started

Let's start by importing the library:

```{r}
# import libs
library(quantrecipes)
```

Here's a quick example for setting-up a recipe to produce Bollinger Bands:

```{r}
# an example recipe
rec <- recipe(. ~ ., data = btcusdt) %>% 
  step_bbands(high, low, close) %>% 
  step_naomit(all_predictors()) %>% 
  prep()

# quick check
juice(rec)
```

Each steps also have `tidy()` methods if you need information regardings the selected `"terms"`:

```{r}
# steps[[1]] is our step_bbands
tidy(rec$steps[[1]])
```

or even the used `"params"`:

```{r}
tidy(rec$steps[[1]], info = "params")
```
